sn11.25:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn11.25:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn11.25:1.4: “Once upon a time, mendicants, Sakka, lord of gods, guiding the gods of the Thirty-Three, recited this verse:
sn11.25:2.2: don’t get angry at angry people.
sn11.25:2.4: are always present in the noble ones.
sn11.25:3.5: The Linked Discourses with Sakka are complete.
sn11.25:4.5: The Book With Verses is finished.
